The Ugly Ducken
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Library: Fan Fiction, Poetry, Birthday List, Links & Non-Fiction Archive: Short Fiction: The Ugly Ducken
By lovesaurian on Friday, November 3, 2000 - 05:45 pm:

This is a short story I wrote based on a classic fairytale. I am not dissing the story in any way, shape, or form. I am merely adapting it to our purpose. Here we go!

Once upon a time, there was a mother ducken, who had three eggs. Two of them were about the size of minature basket balls. The other was a different color, and a bit bigger. The two smaller eggs hatched into regular duckens, attractive long beaks, and multicolored bodies. The other egg hatched into a completely differet monster. It had a short beack, and it was all one color. The mother ducken was bewildered. As her children grew, the two regular ones began to poke fun at the strange one. One day, the other one decieded to just fly off. He far away. he eventually came to a cave in the face of a cliff. When he flew in, he saw two other birds just like him. He was momentarily tacken aback, until one said, "Hello, phoenix." "What? A phoenix?" he asked. "Yes, a phoenix. Like us." "I'm a ducken." he said. The two phoenixes burst out laughing. "No, us phoenixs sometimes hatch from the eggs of other monsters." The three phoenixies quickly became friends.

The End.

Okay, kinda lame, i know. but, in a way funny. To see monsters acting out a classic fairy tale. Just thought it would amuse u guys.

By Phoenix Masta on Saturday, November 4, 2000 - 01:34 pm:

I'm not dissing the story but I AM dissing the Duckens. How dare those pathetic monsters laugh at the mighty Phoenix.Hmmmmm roast Ducken sounds good. Phoenix Masta, the vengeful one with the even more vengeful phoenix, out(to lunch)
